doc.title: Navigation directive

value.content:
CSP navigation directives are used in a Content-Security-Policy header and govern to which location a user can navigate to or submit a form to, for example.

Navigation directives don't fall back to the default-src directive.

See Navigation directives for a complete list.

value.title: See also
value.content:
• https://www.w3.org/TR/CSP/#directives-navigation
  • Other kinds of directives:
    • Fetch directive
    • Document directive
    • Reporting directive
    • block-all-mixed-content
    • upgrade-insecure-requests
    • require-sri-for
    • trusted-types
  • Content-Security-Policy

doc.summary: CSP navigation directives are used in a Content-Security-Policy header and govern to which location a user can navigate to or submit a form to, for example.
